segment.source: Enterprise shared storage defines local data locations for line of business apps to share data.
segment.target: Enterprise shared storage defines local data locations for line of business apps to share data.

segment.source: The shared storage consists of two locations, where apps with the restricted capability enterpriseDeviceLockdown and an Enterprise certificate have full read and write access.
segment.target: The shared storage consists of two locations, where apps with the restricted capability enterpriseDeviceLockdown and an Enterprise certificate have full read and write access.

segment.source: Note that the enterpriseDeviceLockdown capability allows apps to use the device lock down API and access the enterprise shared storage folders.
segment.target: Note that the enterpriseDeviceLockdown capability allows apps to use the device lock down API and access the enterprise shared storage folders.

segment.source: For more information about the API, see Windows.Embedded.DeviceLockdown namespace.
segment.target: For more information about the API, see Windows.Embedded.DeviceLockdown namespace.

segment.source: These locations are set on the local drive:
segment.target: These locations are set on the local drive:

segment.source: Enterprise shared storage provides support for the following scenarios.
segment.target: Enterprise shared storage provides support for the following scenarios.

segment.source: You can share data within an instance of an app, between instances of the same app, or even between apps assuming they both have the appropriate capability and certificate.
segment.target: You can share data within an instance of an app, between instances of the same app, or even between apps assuming they both have the appropriate capability and certificate.

segment.source: You can store data on the local hard drive in the \Data\SharedData\Enterprise\Persistent folder and it persists even after the device has been reset.
segment.target: You can store data on the local hard drive in the \Data\SharedData\Enterprise\Persistent folder and it persists even after the device has been reset.

segment.source: Manipulate files, including read, write, and delete of files on a device via Mobile Device Management (MDM) service.
segment.target: Manipulate files, including read, write, and delete of files on a device via Mobile Device Management (MDM) service.

segment.source: For more information on how to use enterprise shared storage through the MDM service, see EnterpriseExtFileSystem CSP.
segment.target: For more information on how to use enterprise shared storage through the MDM service, see EnterpriseExtFileSystem CSP.

segment.source: The following example shows how to declare the capability to access enterprise shared storage in the package manifest, and how to access the shared storage folders by using the Windows.Storage.StorageFolder class.
segment.target: The following example shows how to declare the capability to access enterprise shared storage in the package manifest, and how to access the shared storage folders by using the Windows.Storage.StorageFolder class.

segment.source: In your app package manifest, include the following capability:
segment.target: In your app package manifest, include the following capability:
